meanings.definition: To feel or show compassion towards someone who is suffering.
meanings.sent1: She compassionated her friend who was feeling sad.
meanings.sent2: The nurse compassionated the patient in pain.
meanings.sent3: The puppy compassionated the kitten when it got scared of thunder.
meanings.sent4: The teacher compassionated the student struggling with the assignment.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter compassionated the family whose house burned down.

meanings.definition: Showing kindness and understanding towards others in difficult situations.
meanings.sent1: He had a compassionated heart and always helped those in need.
meanings.sent2: The compassionated response from the community was heartwarming.
meanings.sent3: The compassionated gesture made everyone smile during the tough times.
meanings.sent4: Her compassionated words brought comfort to the grieving family.
meanings.sent5: The compassionated act of sharing brought joy to the homeless shelter residents.
